hedline.hl1: Avis and Hertz Provide Phones Abroad

abstract.p: Avis and Hertz are offering customers global roaming cell phones when renting cars in Europe (S)

block.p: Travelers can arrive on foreign soil with a cell phone and a working telephone number when renting cars from Avis or Hertz.

Avis Europe provides international customers with global roaming cell phones free of charge for 21 days (the customer pays for air time). A telephone is shipped to a home or office free of charge and ready to dial, along with personal business cards with the phone number, an extra battery and electrical adapters. The phone, a Nokia precharged with three to five hours of talk time, has a 24-hour customer service number programmed in, as are numbers for its message center and customer-service and road-assistance lines. Call (800) 331-1084.
Travelers can arrive on foreign soil with a cell phone and a working telephone number when renting cars from Avis or Hertz.

Avis Europe provides international customers with global roaming cell phones free of charge for 21 days (the customer pays for air time). A telephone is shipped to a home or office free of charge and ready to dial, along with personal business cards with the phone number, an extra battery and electrical adapters. The phone, a Nokia precharged with three to five hours of talk time, has a 24-hour customer service number programmed in, as are numbers for its message center and customer-service and road-assistance lines. Call (800) 331-1084.

Through Dec. 31, Hertz's international customers renting cellular phones for a week or more will receive the first three days free. Phones cost $7.95 a day or $49 a week; customers pay air time charges. The phones, Ericssons or Motorolas, are delivered ahead (round-trip shipping is $25) with two charged batteries, an automobile charger and a universal adapter; (800) 654-3001.
